snippet: The defeat of the Islamist militants suggests that momentum in the nearly six-year war against Boko Haram may finally be shifting.
abstract: Chad reports that its military forces have chased Boko Haram militants from Nigerian town of Gamboru Ngala, marking its second routing of extremists from long-held position in a week; incident points to Nigeria's failure to deal with militants on its own soil in conflict in which Chad appears to have taken lead.

byline.contributor: Martin Zoutane contributed reporting from Ndjamena, Chad.

lead_paragraph: The defeat of the Islamist militants suggests that momentum in the nearly six-year war against Boko Haram may finally be shifting.

headline.main: Chad Retakes Nigerian Town From Militant Group Boko Haram
headline.print_headline: Nigerian Town Is Taken Back From Militants
